name: Community Priorities 01
question: Identify the motivators for your engagement in this team, and what you best represents the needs of you and your community.

name: Community Priorities 02
question: What motivates you to work on this project?

name: Community Priorities 03
question: What are your top community needs for broadband?
answers: Schools: Support our schools and other institutions.
Students: Our kids need the internet at home to do their homework.
Government Access: Residents can access government services.
Telehealth: Residents can access telehealth and other health services.
Retain Businesses: Support and keep existing businesses in the area.
Attract Businesses: Attract new businesses and drive economic development.
Skilled Workforce: Our workforce needs stronger digital skills.
Home Based Work: Enable working from home and home based businesses.
Attract Young Workers: Retain and attract younger people to the area.

name: Community Priorities 04
question: What are your top broadband service challenges?
answers: Access: Broadband service is not available in all or parts of our community.
Quality: Broadband service quality is poor or unreliable.
Speed (Availability): High speed services are not available.
Speed (Delivery): Advertised services are not delivered
Price: Broadband service is too expensive for the services offered.

name: Community Priorities 05
question: If there are other areas of concern, please explain:

name: Community Priorities 06
question: Describe your community vision/goals and how improved broadband supports those goals.

name: Community Priorities 07
question: How important is better broadband compared with other priorities in your community?
answers: Top of mind for many people
